kszucs commented on issue #2323: [WIP] ARROW-2910: [Packaging] Build from official apache archive
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2323#issuecomment-408239209
 
 
   @cpcloud @wesm I'm afraid this is going to take more time, there are a lot of hardcoded behaviour and paths. Testing is painful, consumes a lot of time. 
   
   Ideally We either build from git (this is functional on arrow master):
   1. Clone Arrow
   2. Build a source archive (currently this is done only for [linux packages](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/linux-packages/Rakefile#L72) - others use the git repo directly)
   3. Build the particular binaries
   
   Or build from apache source archive (implemented by this PR):
   1. Download source archive (produced by `02-source.sh`)
   2. Build the particular binaries (`wheel-linux-*` and `linux-*` builds are not yet working with this setup)
   
   The linux Rakefile already handles multiple sources (git + build the source archive, rc archive, release archive), which We should turn off. Actually We don't have arrow's repository around when it builds from release archive, but the Rakefile [expects](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/linux-packages/Rakefile#L24) the git repo too. 
   
   @kou Could You refactor the rake tasks to support both methods and receive all of the required parameters via arguments and/or env variables (in the first case We'd have a directory containing a git repository, in the second case We'd have the [extracted source archive](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2323/files#diff-66ceaeef0ef768c9dcd99e8da32ce261R43)). 
   
   Also shouldn't We update the [changelog](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/linux-packages/package-task.rb#L298) etc. in `02-source.sh`?

kou commented on issue #2323: [WIP] ARROW-2910: [Packaging] Build from official apache archive
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2323#issuecomment-408359225
 
 
   If we merge #2331, we don't need to run `rake version:update` for release build because it's done in `00-prepare.sh`. How about the following changes?
   
   ```diff
   diff --git a/dev/tasks/crossbow.py b/dev/tasks/crossbow.py
   index 2c57a9ca..4ccc3db1 100755
   --- a/dev/tasks/crossbow.py
   +++ b/dev/tasks/crossbow.py
   @@ -304,6 +304,10 @@ class Target:
            else:
                return '{}.0.{}'.format(base_version, rc)
    
   +    @property
   +    def is_release(self):
   +        return re.match(r'\d+\.\d+\.\d+\Z', self.version) is not None
   +
        def _split_version(self):
            match = re.match(r'(.+)-(rc\d+)\Z', self.version)
            if match is None:
   diff --git a/dev/tasks/linux-packages/travis.linux.yml b/dev/tasks/linux-packages/travis.linux.yml
   index ec89cdbc..1f9cced6 100644
   --- a/dev/tasks/linux-packages/travis.linux.yml
   +++ b/dev/tasks/linux-packages/travis.linux.yml
   @@ -69,7 +69,9 @@ install:
    
    script:
      - pushd arrow/dev/tasks/linux-packages
   +{%- if not arrow.is_release %}
      - rake version:update
   +{%- endif %}
    {%- if arrow.source == 'git' %}
      - rake dist
    {%- endif %}
   ```

kszucs commented on issue #2323: [WIP] ARROW-2910: [Packaging] Build from official apache archive
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2323#issuecomment-408380995
 
 
   FYI Testing from git:
   ```bash
   python crossbow.py submit -g linux
   ```
   
   Testing via source archive:
   ```bash
   # create source archive on github releases
   cd arrow_git_repo
   git tag -d apache-arrow-0.10.0 
   git tag apache-arrow-0.10.0
   git push --tags -f
   
   # submit build from tarball without checksum verification
   python crossbow.py submit \
       --no-verify \
       --arrow-dist https://github.com/kszucs/arrow/archive/apache-arrow-0.10.0.tar.gz  \
       -g linux
   ```

----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

comments.body:
[~wesmckinn] This PR introduces a lot of duplications, bash and batch scripts inside the CI templates. I'd favor to move crossbow to a separate module, bootstrap crossbow at the beginning of each build and implement the download+verification step in the python module instead - with tests. Testing through CIs makes me bald.

Until that We could continue to build from git, the nightly builds are kinda stable [https://github.com/kszucs/crossbow/branches/all?utf8=%E2%9C%93&query=nightly]

 

What do You think?

What does "a separate module" mean, another git repo? What are the benefits of doing that? If we decide to do that (if it is deemed a good idea), as long as we keep the development "inside the community" (i.e. we would create something like apache/arrow-crossbow) then it is OK with me
No, I meant just a crossbow package within arrow. My real question was about delaying this issue after crossbow has its own package and test suite.
Seems we may not be ready for this in 0.12. Moving to 0.13
[~wesmckinn] I don't think We'll have time to address this, suggest to move it to 0.14
Still valid, it would be nice to use the official source tarball but the scripts are currently wired to use the repository.
Closing as this is evidently not preventing the project from operating
